description: Arisaema thunbergii subsp. urashima is an incredible plant species with an array of fascinating features. Its unique, often-unexpected inflorescence will turn heads in any garden, as each flower resembles a maroon-colored cobra with a bright yellow center. It grows in two different distinct forms, one with 3-6 leaflets and the other with 9-12 leaflets, so you never quite know what you're going to get. Additionally, it is hardy, tolerating sun and shade with ease, and only needs minimal care. Perfect for a patio or small garden, it's an exceptional choice for anyone fascinated by the beauty of nature.
